com.fasterxml.clustermate.service

Class LastAccessStore<K extends EntryKey,E extends StoredEntry<K>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fasterxml.clustermate.service.LastAccessStore<K,E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StartAndStoppable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BDBLastAccessStore

    public abstract class LastAccessStore<K extends EntryKey,E extends StoredEntry<K>>
extends Object
implements StartAndStoppable
    Class that encapsulates optional storage of last-accessed information, which implementations may choose to use for things like dynamic expiration of not-recently-accessed entries.

    Keys are derived from entry keys, so that grouped entries typically map to a single entry, whereas individual entries just use key as is or do not use last-accessed information at all.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  LastAccessStore.LastAccessIterationCallback
      Callback for safe traversal over last-accessed entries; mostly needed for clean up or statistics gathering operations.

      • hasEfficientEntryCount

        public abstract boolean hasEfficientEntryCount()
        Method for checking whether link getEntryCount() has a method to produce entry count using a method that is more efficient than explicitly iterating over entries. Note that even if true is returned, some amount of iteration may be required, and operation may still be more expensive than per-entry access.

      • getEntryCount

        public abstract long getEntryCount()
        Accessor for getting approximate count of entries in the underlying main entry database, if (but only if) it can be accessed in constant time without actually iterating over data.
